page.title: 03CUSTOMS IN BIRCH PART TWO
page.content: { APRIL}- On Mothering Sunday the children give small bunches of flowers to the mothers at the end of the service. { JUNE}- Birch School holds its annual fete. The main attraction is the huge crane which gives magnificent views. JULY - A leavers service in Church to present children with bibles. { AUGUST}- A Flower Festival is held in the church,demonstrations are given by the Elizabethan dancers and teas are served in the school. { SEPTEMBER}- Early in the month the W.I. hold their Flower and Produce show in the village Hall. Harvest Festival is at the end of the month. { NOVEMBER}- Rememberance Sunday begins with a service at the War Memorial. { DECEMBER}- A Christingle Service is held early in the month to celebrate Advent. Church Bazaar in Village Hall.
